three.middle:
What is Heimdal?
Heimdal is an implementation of Kerberos 5 (and some more stuff) largely written in Sweden (which was important when we started writing it, less so now). It is freely available under a three clause BSD style license.
Other free implementations include the one from MIT, and Shishi. Also Microsoft Windows and Sun's Java come with implementations of Kerberos.
Code
The code is currently at release
and is available at www.h5l.org/dist/, also mirrored by SUNET.
Information about where to find the source code and older release history is also available. All code is signed with Heimdal's signing key.
Mail
There are two mailings lists: heimdal-announce and heimdal-discuss (ml-archive, mail-archive, gmane).
Bug reports can be submitted via the <a href="https://github.com/heimdal/heimdal/issues/>GitHub's Heimdal Issues page. Security sensitive bug reports should be sent to heimdal-bugs@h5l.org using this PGP key (key id 3B81827E).
See more on the info page.
Contribute
There are several ways you can contribute to the Heimdal project. See also the development page for change logs and source repository information.
